pullRequest.body:
These results are fully analogous to existing results about products, but are missing in mathlib.
While at it, also add the four-way commutativity `sumSumSumComm`, whose product analogue is already in mathlib.

Extracted from the bordism theory branch (which wants to prove smooth analogues of these results).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

bors d+
bors d+
This is too heavy an import for this file I think, and you don't need it with my fix below.

Can you explain more why importing aesop is a heavy import? Those proofs can be replaced by the output of aesop?, right? (In any case, your proposed proof is nicer, so I have removed the import again.)

It's only too heavy an import because this is a *very* low-level file, so we want to maintain as few dependencies as possible. Especially because you'd be importing the entirety of Aesop just for one declaration in a file of over a thousand lines. Make sense?
Yes, this makes sense - thanks for explaining. (I checked: aesop has about 15000 lines of code, in a hundred files. That's definitely a heavy dependency.)

Remember, `` is not a reducible transparency, and `Function.comp` is not a `simp` lemma. You need to unfold it manually.
```suggestion
  left_inv x := by simp [Function.comp]
  right_inv x := by simp [Function.comp]
```
In fact, this makes me wonder slightly if your definitions of `toFun` and `invFun` should not be written in point-free style, but rather with a `match`. I'm not sure about the answer to this, maybe you can explore?
I'm not sure if I understand your suggestion with a match. Can you say more about this?
Yes, I'll get to it today.

Sorry, I got distracted. This is what I meant, but I'm not saying it's actually better:
```lean
/-- Four-way commutativity of `sum`. The name matches `add_add_add_comm`. -/
@[simps apply]
def sumSumSumComm (   ) : (  )      (  )     where
  toFun := fun
    | inl (inl a) => inl (inl a)
    | inl (inr b) => inr (inl b)
    | inr (inl c) => inl (inr c)
    | inr (inr d) => inr (inr d)
  invFun := fun
    | inl (inl a) => inl (inl a)
    | inl (inr c) => inr (inl c)
    | inr (inl b) => inl (inr b)
    | inr (inr d) => inr (inr d)
  left_inv := by rintro ((a | b) | c | d); all_goals rfl
  right_inv := by rintro ((a | c) | b | d); all_goals rfl
```

No worries; thanks for elaborating. I also like your definition. I'm not sure either which one is better. (Both would be nice to have.)
I'll merge this PR as-is; if you think this relation would be useful to have, just say so and I can file a follow-up PR to either change the definition (and add the equality with the current definition as lemmas) or vice versa).
This and the rest of the lemmas here seem to be dumped in the middle of a `Prod` section. There are a few lemmas here about `Sum` (e.g., `sumCongr`). Maybe this fits better there?

`sumCongr` is right next to `prodCongr` and a `Congr` definition...
I moved this into its own section, right before the corresponding `Prod` section.
Probably you should just deal with this now?

```suggestion
-- Commutativity and associativity of the disjoint union of topological spaces,
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: disjoint union of topological spaces is commutative and associative
